channel.title: Adjusting how much power is gone into hardware?
channel.description:
I was wondering if there is a way I can send more power to my USB ports.
Will they still work?
I wanted to do this because say I was charging my phone, my USB ports on my computer do not send enough power as my wall socket would.

item.title: Adjusting how much power is gone into hardware?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

It’s up to the external device to communicate over the data pins to request more power. If the charger provides more power but ur computer doesn’t then ur hardware simply doesn’t support it (or it needs to be enabled in bios, but that’s unlikely). Try a powered usb hub.

Read full topic
item.source: Adjusting how much power is gone into hardware?

item.title: Adjusting how much power is gone into hardware?
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:5, topic:544893”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=663771.msg4436446#msg4436446 date=1405202459]
Check BIOS, I doubt it will be there though.

i meant to say you can increase voltage to charge faster
[/quote]
It’s not in BIOS.[/quote]

Not supported by your MOBO then

Read full topic
